wordpressPost.title: WeSpire's Employee Engagement Platform Wins MITX Award!
wordpressPost.content:
Boston start-ups brought in $33 billion in venture capital in 2013 (Source: National Venture Capital Association). But if there is still any question about Boston as a technology innovation hub, last night provided a resounding answer! Massachusetts Innovation & Technology Exchange (MITX) held its “What’s Next?” Awards ceremony. MITX, one of the top Internet business and marketing associations in our region, celebrated the innovators in the technology community, and they did it up right. The vibe in the room was electric.

The Best of Massachusetts Innovation

The awards are broken into three broad categories: Imagination, industry, and innovation, with subcategories totaling 31. With over 300 applicants, the quality of finalists was top notch. WeSpire’s Employee Engagement Platform was a finalist in the “Best Doing Good Innovation” category, and we’re honored and thrilled to win. The judges recognized our platform as enabling a scalable reduction in environmental impact through a more engaged employee base – we call it meaningful technology.
The best of Boston’s digital ecosystem – the industries, innovation, and imagination – were represented last evening. Much of that was enabled through the efforts of Former Mayor Tom Menino. In recognition of his significant contributions to establishing Boston as an innovation hub, Menino received the MITX “Innovation Hall of Fame” Award. In his acceptance speech, he stated that the award nominees “are the future” and are changing communities around the world for the better. You didn’t have to look too far to understand what he meant.

Thank you to our community

We are proud to be a member of the MITX community and to have been named a winner. Thank you to the judges, our customers, and our hard-working team, and congratulations to the other finalists and winners!
Tip of the night – if you’re looking for an awesomely funny, totally irreverent emcee, look no further than John Michael Higgins. The pace and pitch were perfect. The MITX team hit a home run with him.
